sn15.20:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.
sn15.20:1.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
sn15.20:2.1: “Mendicants, this transmigration has no known beginning.
sn15.20:2.2: No first point is found of sentient beings roaming and transmigrating, shrouded by ignorance and fettered by craving.
sn15.20:2.3: Once upon a time, mendicants, this Mount Vepulla was known as Pācīnavaṁsa.
sn15.20:2.4: And at that time people were known as Tivaras.
sn15.20:2.5: The lifespan of the Tivaras was 40,000 years.
sn15.20:2.6: It took them four days to climb Mount Vepulla, and four days to descend.
sn15.20:2.7: At that time Kakusandha, the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha arose in the world.
sn15.20:2.8: Kakusandha had a fine pair of chief disciples named Vidhura and Sañjīva.
sn15.20:2.9: See, mendicants! This mountain’s name has vanished, those people have passed away, and that Buddha has become fully quenched.
sn15.20:2.13: This is quite enough for you to become disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed regarding all conditions.
sn15.20:3.1: Once upon a time this Mount Vepulla was known as Vaṅkaka.
sn15.20:3.2: And at that time people were known as Rohitassas.
sn15.20:3.3: The lifespan of the Rohitassas was 30,000 years.
sn15.20:3.4: It took them three days to climb Mount Vepulla, and three days to descend.
sn15.20:3.5: At that time Koṇāgamana, the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha arose in the world.
sn15.20:3.6: Koṇāgamana had a fine pair of chief disciples named Bhiyyosa and Uttara.
sn15.20:3.7: See, mendicants! This mountain’s name has vanished, those people have passed away, and that Buddha has become fully quenched.
sn15.20:4.1: Once upon a time this Mount Vepulla was known as Supassa.
sn15.20:4.2: And at that time people were known as Suppiyas.
sn15.20:4.3: The lifespan of the Suppiyas was 20,000 years.
sn15.20:4.4: It took them two days to climb Mount Vepulla, and two days to descend.
sn15.20:4.5: At that time Kassapa, the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha arose in the world.
sn15.20:4.6: Kassapa had a fine pair of chief disciples named Tissa and Bhāradvāja.
sn15.20:4.7: See, mendicants! This mountain’s name has vanished, those people have passed away, and that Buddha has become fully quenched.
sn15.20:5.1: These days this Mount Vepulla is known as Vepulla.
sn15.20:5.2: And these people are known as Magadhans.
sn15.20:5.3: The lifespan of the Magadhans is short, brief, and fleeting.
sn15.20:5.4: A long life is a hundred years or a little more.
sn15.20:5.5: It takes the Magadhans an hour to climb Mount Vepulla, and an hour to descend.
sn15.20:5.6: And now I am the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha who has arisen in the world.
sn15.20:5.7: I have a fine pair of chief disciples named Sāriputta and Moggallāna.
sn15.20:5.8: There will come a time when this mountain’s name will vanish, those people will die, and I will be fully extinguished.
sn15.20:5.12: This is quite enough for you to become disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed regarding all conditions.”
sn15.20:6.1: That is what the Buddha said.
sn15.20:6.2: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn15.20:8.2: their nature is to rise and fall;
sn15.20:9.5: The Linked Discourses on the unknown beginning are complete.
